intro: Urginea somalensis, commonly known as the Somali giant lily, is a striking plant native to the dry regions of Somalia. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white or pale purple flowers. The plant features broad, strap-like leaves and a bulbous underground stem that stores water and nutrients. It thrives in arid environments and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Due to its rarity and ecological significance, it is considered a valuable species in botanical research and conservation efforts.
